duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide comprehensive assessment, planning, and implementation of individual patient needs for enhanced patient management and satisfaction.
Integrate and perform functions of case management, utilization review, and discharge planning to promote continuity of care and cost effectiveness.
Prioritize patient cases, conduct assessments, and document care plans according to departmental guidelines.
Participate in care management meetings and collaborate with the care team to address patient concerns and progressions.
Coordinate family meetings and provide education on community resources and support groups for patients and their families.
Ensure appropriate communication of medical milestones and discharge plans to patients and families.
Document activities, events, and information per standards in established software systems in a timely, accurate, and complete manner.
Maintain confidentiality and compliance with privacy and health information policies.
Participate in process improvement initiatives and maintain current knowledge of institutional and departmental guidelines.

education_certification.credential: Graduation from a state-accredited school of professional nursing. If hired after October 1, 2015, must be enrolled in an accredited program within four years of employment and obtain a Bachelor's degree with a major in Nursing or a Master's degree with a major in Nursing within seven years of employment date.
